infos.value: ...Foolish.
A long-distance communication device...
As I suspected, it ended up in your hands.
...You are listening, are you not? Sadali.
Ho ho. I expected no less, Gilgamesh.
Slaying so many Sanctum monks with such miniscule effort...
What a fine opportunity it was to test your power.
You are willing to sacrifice this many, yet you cling to your own life so desperately?
What else?
The Cocoon of Light is mine. No one else shall have it.
You still do not understand.
It is too much for man to handle.
Should you misuse it, the world will pay the price—with its destruction.
So the world shall perish if I "misuse" it, you say?
My, would that not be grand?
A world without Exia is not a world worth living in, anyway.
I will use any means necesary to kill you.
...Oh, my.
Do you intend to stamp this device into disrepair?
It would not be the first priceless device destroyed by placing it in the hands of a half-witted underling.
Surely you are not so foolish as to—
...Urgent warning.
...Oracle, Chapter 24, Passage 1. The Hour of the Raging Stag.
A descent upon the sacred lands to claim the radiant light.
...Rundall.
